main event: A star-like object was observed in Long Island Sound, New York on June 25, 1960, flying at rapid speed and making a hairpin turn.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 6-8 minutes., The object traveled from South to Northeast and then returned South., It was described as having the brightness of a 1st magnitude star., There was no sound associated with the object during the observation., The report was forwarded to the Air Technical Intelligence Center for further evaluation.
location: Long Island Sound, New York, USA
